article.headline: Pepperdine 97, Santa Clara 93 (OT)
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. (AP) -- Glen McGowan had 27 points, 13 rebounds and an emphatic dunk with 24 seconds left that helped Pepperdine to a 97-93 overtime win over Santa Clara on Thursday night. McGowan, Pepperdine's leading scorer, had made only one field goal in a 10-minute stretch before his dunk over a host of Bronco defenders gave the Waves all the momentum they needed to win for the third time in five games. Alex Acker added 26 points and six rebounds for Pepperdine (15-12, 5-7 WCC) while Kingsley Costain had 21 points, including eight in overtime. Kyle Bailey led five Santa Clara players in double figures with 23 points, all but two coming after halftime, including six 3-pointers. He also missed an off-balance jumper at the end of regulation that would have given the Broncos the win. Travis Niesen added 18 points and Doron Perkins had 14 points and eight rebounds for Santa Clara (13-13, 6-5). Perkins, the Broncos' leading scorer, was held out of the starting lineup for disciplinary reasons by coach Dick Davey after showing up late for a team meeting. McGowan scored the final nine points of the second half for Pepperdine but his missed free throw with 14 seconds remaining prevented the Waves from winning in regulation. McGowan also missed two free throws midway through overtime but came back later to make two before his dunk helped seal the win. Pepperdine led 41-34 at the half but couldn't shake Santa Clara, which came back from five points down with less than five minutes left to force overtime. Bailey and Niesen helped rally the Broncos, combining for 10 points down the stretch, and Perkins added a key three-point play with 34 seconds left to force overtime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
